meanings.sent1: She was peeved when her brother ate the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The peeved customer complained about the long wait.
meanings.sent3: The peeved cat knocked over the vase in protest.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds seemed peeved, ready to burst with rain.
meanings.sent5: His peeved expression made it clear he was not happy.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel annoyed or irritated.
meanings.sent1: Please don't peeve your sister by teasing her.
meanings.sent2: The constant noise from the construction site peeved the residents.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel peeved the dog by stealing its treats.
meanings.sent4: The unanswered emails peeved her, making her feel ignored.
meanings.sent5: His constant interruptions peeved the speaker, disrupting the presentation.
